title: Looking back at Venezuela's Bolivarian revolution
content: The kidnapping of Nicolás Maduro on the night of 2-3 January 2026 did not so much mark Venezuela's return to the international stage as serve as a reminder that the country has never stopped being a major strategic asset. Washington now seems determined to place Venezuela and its natural resources under its control and to pull the country away from its alliances with China, Iran and Russia. In Caracas, Delcy Rodríguez, acting president of the Caribbean nation in Maduro's absence, stated: ‘We (…)...

title: After defeating ISIS, Syria's Kurds are abandoned
content: In 2014, the war against ISIS was focused in Iraq but it was clear that the end would come about only if its forces were destroyed in its Syrian sanctuary. The small contingent of US special forces desperately needed a partner on the ground willing to fight. A local protection unit in the country's northeast – the Syrian Democratic Forces (SDF) – stepped forward. At a cost of over 11,000 dead fighters and uncounted civilians, the predominantly Kurdish SDF defeated ISIS and prevented its (…) - Ou...
creator: Tanya Goudsouzian

title: Mauritians speak out for their macaques
content: Mauritius has become the world's leading exporter of macaques for biomedical research. While some regard the animal as a pest, many Hindus on the island are voicing concerns about the trade. - 2026/01 / article
creator: Guillaume Poisson

title: The US turns back to nuclear power
content: AI's power demands are vast and growing. The Trump administration wants nuclear reactors to meet them. Whether that's achievable, and whether communities will accept it, is another matter. - 2026/01 / article
creator: Eva Thiébaud

title: Hungary: time up for Viktor Orbán?
content: Viktor Orbán has held power in Hungary since 2010 by appealing to rural voters. This spring he faces a formidable challenge from a new party which believes it can beat him at his own game. - 2026/01 / article
creator: Ambre Bruneteau & Corentin Léotard

title: Donbas: the ground neither side will cede
content: In the Ukraine war, western Donetsk has taken on an importance far beyond its strategic value. With neither side ready to pay the political price of yielding, the deadlock risks dangerous escalation. - 2026/01 / article
creator: Anatol Lieven
